Articles.Content: I just made my first moon landing a couple of minutes ago, i think i may keep jeb there forever . Even though many kerbals sacrificed themselves to get me here, I think it was worth all the kerbals stranded orbiting the sun. It took me 7 attempts today to get to the moon, all 7 i could get into an orbit, but hit the ground to fast. How many attempts did it take you guys?
Welcome to the community and congratulations on your first moon landing
Well? Where are the screenshots? Posting those is the best part.

I've lost count of the number of failures. Of course, a lot of them failed for lack of proper landing legs, suitably-sized motors, or (for that matter) any understanding of what I was doing.

Anyway, they all blur together into a waking nightmare of Fail.

I kind of wish I had failed on my first try, because then reaching the goal is even more priceless when you sit back and look at how much effort and time it took... good thing planets are for the next release!

Congratulations!

Congrats! I only completed my first Mun landing a few days ago and my first Minmus landing yesterday. It's a great feeling. I, too, had to sacrifice many, many Kerbals for the greater good of the species.
And now it gets better. Now you'll be able to all kinds of crazy things!
Here is the first picture from the Mun!
I took 5 attempts to get to the Mun,and done it yesterday.

Captin' Skunky hasn't found this thread yet so ill give you my best impersination.

Arrr, Its Captin' Skunky, Welcome to the forums and happy flying!

I kind of wish I had failed on my first try
After my first successful Mun landing, I crashed on every attempt for the next 3 days. Just because you did it once doesn't mean the challenge is gone.

There are still cases I have failed Mun landings due to poor landing spot choices or landing too much on the dark side of the Mun.

For anyone out there, it is best to choose a spot where there is plenty of light or else you might end crashing while trying to land when a side of the Mun is extremely dark.
Well done on landing on the mun. I wouldn't know the difficulties of landing on another body, but I hear it involves alot of failing. Also welcome to the forums.
Thanks guys and i did land on the dark side by accident but i somehow landed and returned home.

It took about 14 failures for me to crash on the mun, then another 2 fails till I landed safely.

It's exciting how if you overshoot the mun by an inch, you are forever doomed to orbit around the sun.
didn't take me too many to land on mun, my problem was transferring and gaining a new orbit, got there eventually though!
Yea i overshot it at first too but luckily i had just enough fuel to land and get back safely.
